Package com.tianscar.awt.x11

Class ColorfulXCursor

java.lang.Object
com.tianscar.awt.x11.ColorfulXCursor
public final class ColorfulXCursor extends Object
The ColorfulXCursor factory class to create X cursors

  • Method Details

    • createImageCursor

      public static Cursor createImageCursor(Image cursor, Point hotSpot, String name) throws IndexOutOfBoundsException, HeadlessException

      Creates a new image cursor object.

      If isARGBSupported() returns false, it fallbacks to Toolkit.createCustomCursor(Image, Point, String)

      If the image to display is invalid, the cursor will be hidden (made completely transparent), and the hotspot will be set to (0, 0).

      Note that multi-frame images are invalid and may cause this method to hang.

      Parameters:
      cursor - the image to display when the cursor is activated
      hotSpot - the X and Y of the large cursor's hot spot; the hotSpot values must be less than the Dimension returned by Toolkit.getBestCursorSize(int, int)
      name - a localized description of the cursor, for Java Accessibility use
      Returns:
      the colorful image cursor, or the original 2-color image cursor if isARGBSupported() returns false
      Throws:
      IndexOutOfBoundsException - if the hotSpot values are outside the bounds of the cursor
      HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
      See Also:
      • GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()
      • Toolkit.createCustomCursor(Image, Point, String)

    • getFontCursor

      public static Cursor getFontCursor(int type) throws IllegalArgumentException, HeadlessException
      Gets font cursor object by type.
      Parameters:
      type - the font cursor type
      Returns:
      the font cursor, or the default cursor if there's no cursor could be found by the type
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if the specified font cursor type is invalid
      HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
      See Also:
      • XCreateFontCursor
      • GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()

    • getLibraryCursor

      public static Cursor getLibraryCursor(String name) throws HeadlessException
      Gets library cursor object by name.
      Parameters:
      name - the library cursor name
      Returns:
      the library cursor, or the default cursor if there's no cursor could be found by the name
      Throws:
      HeadlessException - if GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless() returns true
      See Also:
      • XcursorLibraryLoadCursor
      • GraphicsEnvironment.isHeadless()

    • isARGBSupported

      public static boolean isARGBSupported()
      Returns whether current display supports ARGB-colored cursor
      Returns:
      true if ARGB-colored cursor is supported by current display, false not
